Next, PCA was applied to the acquired SERS spectra. PCA is a dimensionality reduction technique that identifies the most important features or components in the data. It transforms the data into a new set of variables called principal components, which are linear combinations of the original variables. In this case, PCA was used to reduce the dimensionality of the SERS spectra and extract the most relevant information.

After PCA, LDA was applied as a machine learning algorithm. LDA is a supervised classification algorithm that aims to find a linear combination of features that maximizes the separation between different classes.
